"INTRODUCTION\
\
Embossing holds an important position among the professions of Castle Marrach. Those in possession of this desireable skill are able to apply symbolic decorations to many common stationery items, particularly the bindings of books.\
\
Over seventy unique symbols are known to the castle's embossers."

"RELATED CRAFTS\
\
Not all items will succumb to the embosser's press. Jewelry, weapons and most other metal items require the services of an ENGRAVER; clothing is the specialty of the EMBROIDERER; and bodily adornment is the province of the TATOOIST. Embossers are encouraged to acquire skill in one or more of these trades as well."

"PROFICIENCY\
\
Ten levels of proficiency are recognized for the embosser's skill:\
\
1. Novice\
2. Junior Apprentice\
3. Senior Apprentice\
4. Fellowcraft\
5. Journeyman\
6. Artisan\
7. Senior Artisan\
8. Master\
9. Master Adept\
10. Grand Master\
\
A Novice Embosser possesses very limited ability, and is able to attempt only a few rudimentary symbols. As skill increases, however, many more possibilities become available. A seasoned Master may command dozens of decorative options.\
\
The following chapters describe the symbols available to embossers at each level of proficiency."

"NOVICE\
\
Novices are the least experienced embossers. Their decorative effects are admittedly rather plain and utilitarian.\
\
They might apply the none, dot, line, mark, squiggle, smileyface, or potato."

"JUNIOR APPRENTICE\
\
Junior Apprentices know a bit more than Novices, but their additional options can hardly be called impressive.\
\
They work with simple symbols such as the square, circle, triangle, heart, star, moon, sun, key, leaf, and eye."

"SENIOR APPRENTICE\
\
Senior Apprentices have attained sufficient skill to produce a handful of modest but attractive symbols.\
\
A selection of their efforts will include the flower, dove, owl, duck, fish, hare, ermine, cat, rat, boat, kite, chair, plume, and rose."

"FELLOWCRAFT\
\
Fellowcraft embossers have spent many hours learning their craft, and may apply a personal mark to items they emboss.\
\
Their symbols include the clef, quill, mask, thistle, anchor, tankard, hourglass, tree, needle, plow, and scroll, paintbrush, and crow."

"JOURNEYMAN\
\
Journeymen possess the confidence to work with symbols of unique appeal and significance.\
\
Their efforts produce the sword, hammer, fist, skull, thunderbolt, serpent, dagger, scythe, or raven."

"ARTISAN\
\
Artisans are capable of the fine control needed to produce some of the more challenging and beautiful symbols.\
\
Artisans can delineate the monkey, walrus, stag, lion, bull, bear, eagle, boar, wolf, horse, fox, and swan."

"SENIOR ARTISAN\
\
Senior Artisans are sought by those desiring rare and exotic symbols for their books and other embossable possessions. They often serve as assistants to Master embossers.\
\
These persons can apply the trefoil, quatrefoil, cinquefoil, caduceus, lyre, compass, palette, spinningwheel, loom, and rose-vine."

"MASTER\
\
Masters are the virtuosi of the Embosser's art. Their long career of study and craftsmanship has given them the ability to work with complex symbols requiring great skill to execute. They can also alter the symbols of items that have already been embossed.\
\
They might apply the gryphon, unicorn, wyvern, phoenix, manticore, and basilisk."

"MASTER ADEPT\
\
Master Adepts are experts at all aspects of embossing, capable of producing certain symbols of exceptional difficulty and depth of meaning, such as the dragon or the castle."

"GRAND MASTER\
\
The rank of Grand Master is rarely seen within the castle; many seasons may pass without the services of a Grand Master embosser. When present, these rarities practice their art almost entirely for royalty and aristocracy. They command the triflame and snowflake symbols."

"RESTRICTIONS\
\
Embossers are expected to conform to the Queen's Capitulary, regarding forgery and improper usage of official symbols.\
\
Violators of this policy may be subject to arrest, imprisonment, or other punishments."

"UPDATES\
\
As art and fashions change, new symbols are discovered by the castle's crafters. The text of this book will mysteriously update itself as new choices become available. More senior embossers will inform you if and when updates occur.\
\
Please bring typographical errors or other textual problems found in this volume to the attention of staff members."
